verses.verse: And Balaam<WH1109> said<WH559> to Balak,<WH1111> Build<WH1129> me here<WH2088> seven<WH7651> altars,<WH4196> and prepare<WH3559> me here<WH2088> seven<WH7651> oxen<WH6499> and seven<WH7651> rams.<WH352>
And Balak<WH1111> did<WH6213> as Balaam<WH1109> had spoken;<WH1696> and Balak<WH1111> and Balaam<WH1109> offered<WH5927> on<WH5921> every altar<WH4196> a bullock<WH6499> and a ram.<WH352>

And Balaam<WH1109> said<WH559> to Balak,<WH1111> Stand<WH3320> by your burnt<WH5930> offering, and I will go:<WH3212> peradventure<WH194> the LORD<WH3068> will come<WH7136> to meet<WH7125> me: and whatever<WH1697> <WH4100> he shows<WH7200> me I will tell<WH5046> you. And he went<WH3212> to an high<WH8205> place.

And God<WH430> met<WH7136> Balaam:<WH1109> and he said<WH559> to him, I have prepared<WH6186> seven<WH7651> altars,<WH4196> and I have offered<WH5927> on every altar<WH4196> a bullock<WH6499> and a ram.<WH352>
And the LORD<WH3068> put<WH7760> a word<WH1697> in Balaam's<WH1109> mouth,<WH6310> and said,<WH559> Return<WH7725> to Balak,<WH1111> and thus<WH3541> you shall speak.<WH1696>
And he returned<WH7725> to him, and, see,<WH2009> he stood<WH5324> by his burnt<WH5930> sacrifice, he, and all<WH3605> the princes<WH8269> of Moab.<WH4124>

And he took<WH5375> up his parable,<WH4912> and said,<WH559> Balak<WH1111> the king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124> has brought<WH5148> me from Aram,<WH758> out of the mountains<WH2042> of the east,<WH6924> saying, Come,<WH3212> curse<WH779> me Jacob,<WH3290> and come,<WH3212> defy<WH2194> Israel.<WH3478>
How<WH4100> shall I curse,<WH5344> whom God<WH410> has not cursed?<WH6895> or how<WH4100> shall I defy,<WH2194> whom the LORD<WH3068> has not defied?<WH2194>

For from the top<WH7218> of the rocks<WH6697> I see<WH7200> him, and from the hills<WH1389> I behold<WH7789> him: see,<WH2005> the people<WH5971> shall dwell<WH7931> alone,<WH909> and shall not be reckoned<WH2803> among the nations.<WH1471>

Who<WH4310> can count<WH4487> the dust<WH6083> of Jacob,<WH3290> and the number<WH4557> of the fourth<WH7255> part of Israel?<WH3478> Let me die<WH4191> the death<WH4194> of the righteous,<WH3477> and let my last<WH319> end be like<WH3644> his!

And Balak<WH1111> said<WH559> to Balaam,<WH1109> What<WH4100> have you done<WH6213> to me? I took<WH3947> you to curse<WH6895> my enemies,<WH341> and, behold,<WH2009> you have blessed<WH1288> them altogether.
And he answered<WH6030> and said,<WH559> Must I not take heed<WH8104> to speak<WH1696> that which<WH834> the LORD<WH3068> has put<WH7760> in my mouth?<WH6310>

And Balak<WH1111> said<WH559> to him, Come,<WH3212> I pray<WH4994> you, with me to another<WH312> place,<WH4725> from from where<WH834> <WH8033> you may see<WH7200> them: you shall see<WH7200> but the utmost<WH7097> part of them, and shall not see<WH7200> them all:<WH3605> and curse<WH6895> me them from there.<WH8033>

And he brought<WH3947> him into the field<WH7704> of Zophim,<WH6839> to the top<WH7218> of Pisgah,<WH6449> and built<WH1129> seven<WH7651> altars,<WH4196> and offered<WH5927> a bullock<WH6499> and a ram<WH352> on<WH5921> every altar.<WH4196>
And he said<WH559> to Balak,<WH1111> Stand<WH3320> here<WH3541> by your burnt<WH5930> offering, while I meet<WH7136> the LORD yonder.<WH3541>
And the LORD<WH3068> met<WH7136> Balaam,<WH1109> and put<WH7760> a word<WH1697> in his mouth,<WH6310> and said,<WH559> Go<WH7725> again<WH7725> to Balak,<WH1111> and say<WH1696> thus.<WH3541>

And when he came<WH935> to him, behold,<WH2009> he stood<WH5324> by his burnt<WH5930> offering, and the princes<WH8269> of Moab<WH4124> with him. And Balak<WH1111> said<WH559> to him, What<WH4100> has the LORD<WH3068> spoken?<WH1696>
And he took<WH5375> up his parable,<WH4912> and said,<WH559> Rise<WH6965> up, Balak,<WH1111> and hear;<WH8085> listen<WH238> to me, you son<WH1121> of Zippor:<WH6834>

God<WH410> is not a man,<WH376> that he should lie;<WH3576> neither the son<WH1121> of man,<WH120> that he should repent:<WH5162> has he said,<WH559> and shall he not do<WH6213> it? or has he spoken,<WH1696> and shall he not make it good?<WH6965>
Behold,<WH2009> I have received<WH3947> commandment to bless:<WH1288> and he has blessed;<WH1288> and I cannot<WH3808> reverse<WH7725> it.

He has not beheld<WH5027> iniquity<WH205> in Jacob,<WH3290> neither<WH3808> has he seen<WH7200> perverseness<WH5999> in Israel:<WH3478> the LORD<WH3068> his God<WH430> is with him, and the shout<WH8643> of a king<WH4428> is among them.
God<WH410> brought<WH3318> them out of Egypt;<WH4714> he has as it were the strength<WH8443> of an unicorn.<WH7214>

Surely there is no<WH3808> enchantment<WH5172> against Jacob,<WH3290> neither<WH3808> is there any divination<WH7081> against Israel:<WH3478> according to this time<WH6256> it shall be said<WH559> of Jacob<WH3290> and of Israel,<WH3478> What<WH4100> has God<WH410> worked!<WH6466>

Behold,<WH2005> the people<WH5971> shall rise<WH6965> up as a great<WH3833> lion,<WH3833> and lift<WH5375> up himself as a young lion:<WH738> he shall not lie<WH7901> down<WH7901> until<WH5704> he eat<WH398> of the prey,<WH2964> and drink<WH8354> the blood<WH1818> of the slain.<WH2491>
And Balak<WH1111> said<WH559> to Balaam,<WH1109> Neither<WH1571> <WH3808> curse<WH6895> them at all, nor<WH3808> bless<WH1288> them at all.
But Balaam<WH1109> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> to Balak,<WH1111> Told<WH1696> not I you, saying,<WH559> All<WH3605> that the LORD<WH3068> speaks,<WH1696> that I must do?<WH6213>

And Balak<WH1111> said<WH559> to Balaam,<WH1109> Come,<WH3212> I pray<WH4994> you, I will bring<WH3947> you to another<WH312> place;<WH4725> peradventure<WH194> it will please<WH3477> <WH5869> God<WH430> that you may curse<WH6895> me them from there.<WH8033>
And Balak<WH1111> brought<WH3947> Balaam<WH1109> to the top<WH7218> of Peor,<WH6465> that looks<WH8259> toward<WH5921> <WH6440> Jeshimon.<WH3452>

And Balaam<WH1109> said<WH559> to Balak,<WH1111> Build<WH1129> me here<WH2088> seven<WH7651> altars,<WH4196> and prepare<WH3559> me here<WH2088> seven<WH7651> bullocks<WH6499> and seven<WH7651> rams.<WH352>
And Balak<WH1111> did<WH6213> as Balaam<WH1109> had said,<WH559> and offered<WH5927> a bullock<WH6499> and a ram<WH352> on<WH5921> every altar.<WH4196>
